title: What's the difference between Trap music and Drill music? - Quora

response.answer_text: A few things come to mind… To begin your 808 choice between trap and drill will be very different. I’m assuming you’re wondering about “American Drill” so here is 3 most important features in both to me. 808 (drill) Your 808 of choice will be a spinz. An 808 which is easily EQ’ed to become a slide. A slide is the part of the 808 pattern that is a much higher octave than your base 808(usually at the end of your 4 or 8 bar) 808 (trap) In the modern trap sound the 808 used derived from the original zaytoven 808 has been altered to hit faster and be punchier. Hi hat pattern (drill) off the top of my head I know it’s (this is 4bars) 1st / 3rd / 5th / 5.5 /7 it’s a little off beat at first but with a clap or snare it makes more sense Hi Hat pattern trap Could be a 1 bar could be a half bar really doesn’t matter with trap you can do rolls and all that but it’s more on beat compared to drill Clap Drill The clap will be on your 2nd bar and then on your 6th bar that’s what is the most distinct feature of drill to me besides the off beat hi hat pattern. The way you have to wait for the 2nd clap really gives the bounce. Clap Trap Will have a basic 2nd and 4th bar placement. Also! Here is 2 great drum kits to get you started! DRILL SAMPLE The Lunch77 808 Melo & Axl Drumkit.zip MODERN HIP HOP SAMPLE The Lunch77 Wheezy Drumkit.zip

Well, to be honest I haven’t listened to very many ‘Drill’ songs, but from what I’ve heard it seems to be objectively lamer XD.That may just be a taste thing, I don’t know, but I do know that everyone has their preferences. However, when it comes to Trap music I have definitely heard my fair share of it. Anyways, Trap beats tend to have very strong similarities like thick basses, the sound of a hat on every 8th beat with some possible variation; the list goes on. There’s a video of an awesome musician that gives tutorials on how to make music. While he’s made one on trap, he hasn’t made one on Drill- regardless, he breaks Trap down to a nice, malleable jam. His name’s Frankjavcee, and for fair warning he curses. But if since you’re asking this question, I don’t really feel like that’ll be an issue. :)How to make Trap Music
